data.text: I was the primary and only developer for The McBride Company. This project was built with CraftCMS, TailwindCSS, and Twig.

When it came to UI interations and animations, I was able to use my knowledge of CSS and Javascript to create a unique experience for the user. The designs were provided statically without any animations or interactions note or guides, so I was able to use my own creativity to bring the designs to life. I utilized Figma to create the SVG's for some of the animations.
Homepage and navigation animations and interactions
There were no loading animations in the design when it was passed to development. Below are a couple of examples of UI loaders I created to add some flare to the site.
Here is the loader for the site which plays with the design of their logo...
...and here is the loader for images.

The client wanted an easter egg for the changing staff pictures. Initially, the designer came up with a solution where the user would have to hover over the images to see the easter egg. After UX testing, I found users were not hovering over the images, so I came up with a solution where the easter egg would be triggered after X amount of time.
